Class ByteBufferPool

java.lang.Object
com.quietterminal.projectneon.core.ByteBufferPool
public class ByteBufferPool extends Object
Thread-safe object pool for byte arrays to reduce GC pressure. Reuses byte buffers across packet operations instead of allocating new arrays.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ByteBufferPool(int bufferSize, int initialPoolSize, int maxPoolSize)
    Creates a buffer pool with specified parameters.

  • Constructor Details

    • ByteBufferPool

      public ByteBufferPool(int bufferSize, int initialPoolSize, int maxPoolSize)
      Creates a buffer pool with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      bufferSize - size of each buffer in bytes
      initialPoolSize - number of buffers to pre-allocate
      maxPoolSize - maximum number of buffers to retain in pool

  • Method Details

    • acquire

      public byte[] acquire()
      Acquires a buffer from the pool. If pool is empty, allocates a new buffer.
      Returns:
      a byte array of the configured buffer size

    • release

      public void release(byte[] buffer)
      Returns a buffer to the pool for reuse. Only buffers of the correct size are accepted.
      Parameters:
      buffer - the buffer to return

    • availableBuffers

      public int availableBuffers()
      Gets the current number of available buffers in the pool.
      Returns:
      number of buffers ready for reuse

    • getBufferSize

      public int getBufferSize()
      Gets the configured buffer size.
      Returns:
      buffer size in bytes
